1873_1912.surfaceForm: Esposizione per il Traforo del Sempione

was: a German painter , advertiser , illustrator , set designer and costume designer

considered: the father of Italian poster art and an exponent of the Stile Liberty , the Italian Art Nouveau
Together with Leonetto Cappiello , Giovanni Mario Mataloni , Leopoldo Metlicovitz and Marcello Dudovich
one of the most important Italian poster designers

born: in Saint Petersburg , the capital of Russian Empire ,
to German parents , Julius and Laura Irack

was: a forest engineer , whose career prompted him to travel extensively

moved: to Vienna where he grew up and completed his studies

took: to India , where he decorated the houses of the local nobility

decorated: the houses of the local nobility

became: a set and costume designer for La Scala and other theatres

began: to work for the Ricordi Graphical Workshops , where he shortly became the artistic director in charge of the graphical part

work: for the Ricordi Graphical Workshops , where he shortly became the artistic director in charge of the graphical part

became: the artistic director in charge of the graphical part

created: the posters for La Bohème and Tosca , as well as publicity for Campari , Buitoni and Corriere della Sera , numerous postcards , covers for scores and booklets

continued: to cover the theatrical dimension : scenarios and wardrobes for several works , among them Giuseppe Verdi 's Falstaff ( 1893 ) and a major part of the works of Giacomo Puccini , from the sketches of Le Villi ( 1884 ) to posters of Madama Butterfly ( 1904 )

cover: scenarios and wardrobes for several works , among them Giuseppe Verdi 's Falstaff ( 1893 ) and a major part of the works of Giacomo Puccini , from the sketches of Le Villi ( 1884 ) to posters of Madama Butterfly ( 1904 )

had: as colleague Giovanni Mario Mataloni and as students Leopoldo Metlicovitz and Marcello Dudovich

traveled: In the first years of the 1900s
after marrying Katharina Plaskuda , a widow
till 1906 , when , after winning the competition for the graphical symbol and the poster for the " Esposizione per il Traforo del Sempione " , he left Milan for Bonn and Düsseldorf definitively

winning: the competition for the graphical symbol and the poster for the " Esposizione per il Traforo del Sempione "

left: In the first years of the 1900s

saw: him engaged mostly as a painter and involved in the decoration of numerous buildings , among them one of the first in constructed reinforced concrete in Renania ( 1911 )

involved: in the decoration of numerous buildings , among them one of the first in constructed reinforced concrete in Renania ( 1911 )

associated: with the Düsseldorf school of painting
